result.execSummary:
The defendant Evans L Lewis Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Evans L Lewis Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Evans L Lewis Jr. was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Evans L Lewis Jr. was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  bond to apply.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.
***AJC - CREDIT FOR 91 DAYS***

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 4; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  If revoked, deft requests credit for 47 days.
